nodes.title: Breaking News: A new Ohio law cuts the training required for teachers and staff to carry guns in schools to a maximum of 24 hours, down from 700. https://t.co/3QG6sWZcCK
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Fox News is broadcasting the second day of the House committee hearing on the Jan. 6 attack after not carrying the first day. The network's hosts told their audience that the committee hearing last week was nothing more than "propaganda." https://t.co/hOV3ctrd0z
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Former Attorney General Bill Barr suggested Donald Trump had grown "detached from reality" on his election fraud claims, as multiple aides testified to the House Jan. 6 committee they told him he'd lost. https://t.co/bNinLyfQd8
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Andrew Giuliani said he will not be able to attend the first Republican debate in the New York City governorâ€™s race unless he sends proof of his Covid vaccination status, which he will not do. He says he is unvaccinated and has "natural immunity." https://t.co/HxNwYP2h5E

nodes.title:
The criminal trial of a man who carried a Confederate flag into the Capitol during the Jan. 6 attack begins on Monday. The man and his son have been charged with crimes including obstructing the final certification of the presidential election.
https://t.co/AINQkL4jNj

The company said its systems imitated conversational exchanges but did not have consciousness. https://t.co/zDUdQENPhs https://t.co/yAingzDnQV

nodes.title: Google has settled a class-action lawsuit that accused it of systematically underpaying women, promising to provide $118 million in monetary relief and invite outsiders to review its practices. https://t.co/fswrnMGIfX

A year ago, gas sold for $3.08. https://t.co/fUY7k4OYA8

nodes.title: Breaking News: Senators struck a bipartisan deal on a narrow set of gun safety measures, bringing them closer to ending a yearslong congressional impasse. https://t.co/ecWuK8VSkN
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The House Jan. 6 committee plans to use the testimony of Donald Trump's own campaign manager, Bill Stepien, against the former president on Monday, as it lays out evidence that Trump knowingly spread the lie that the 2020 election was stolen. https://t.co/JH6gAv2PIU
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
President Jair Bolsonaro of Brazil is trailing in polls for the countryâ€™s presidential race. He said that if he loses, it will most likely be thanks to a stolen vote.

Now he has enlisted a new ally in his fight against the electoral process: the military. https://t.co/lta4NLNiV8
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Of the 10 Republican senators supporting a bipartisan deal on gun safety, four are leaving Congress at the end of the year and five are not up for re-election for another four years. Only Mitt Romney of Utah will face voters in 2024. https://t.co/ERcK7TwGwY https://t.co/q3YKb1MZlx
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: On the 108th day of Vladimir Putinâ€™s unprovoked war on Ukraine, Russia appeared no closer to victory. But its forces did appear to be making slow, methodical and bloody progress toward control of eastern Ukraine. https://t.co/Z3WbcC5WxH
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Google placed an engineer on paid leave after dismissing his claim that its artificial intelligence is sentient. The companyâ€™s human resources department said he had violated Googleâ€™s confidentiality policy. https://t.co/GUcDXAFT8K

nodes.title: They were sterilized without consent as young girls. What does the government owe them â€” and thousands of other living victims? https://t.co/bBSQ8cxe2D

nodes.title:
Itâ€™s soft. Itâ€™s vegan. Itâ€™s made from fossil fuels.

The fashion industry has been transformed by the rebranding of synthetic materials into hip alternatives like "vegan leather," a marketing masterstroke meant to suggest environmental virtue. https://t.co/sGYW1z8Gx0
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Dozens of members of the right-wing group Patriot Front were detained and charged with conspiracy to riot, after the police said they received a tip that a group of people had jumped into a U-Haul van near a Pride event in Coeur dâ€™Alene, Idaho. https://t.co/nagfJxDerE https://t.co/Sd1CKTVmGb
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: A Senate gun safety plan endorsed by 10 Republicans and 10 Democrats falls far short of reforms long championed by gun control activists and a majority of congressional Democrats. It amounts to notable, albeit narrow, progress amid deep party divisions. https://t.co/WEFNp05vCL https://t.co/KNCaulTD1s
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
He had means, motive and opportunity. But did Donald Trump commit a crime?

Several former prosecutors and veteran lawyers said the first prime-time Jan. 6 committee hearing offered the makings of a credible criminal case. https://t.co/W2qELdQVI0
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The day before Jan. 6, 2021, Mike Pence's chief counsel laid out in a three-page memo that the vice president would violate federal law if he bowed to pressure from Donald Trump to interfere with the certification of Joe Biden's victory. https://t.co/dWVJxlOnX3
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Dozens of members of a white supremacist group were arrested on Saturday in Idaho before they could act on plans to riot at a local Pride event, police said. An apparent leader of the group had a seven-page document outlining a plan in extensive detail. https://t.co/46cSB8tihH
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Modernaâ€™s coronavirus vaccine for children under 6 is effective in preventing symptomatic infection without causing worrisome side effects, the Food and Drug Administration said on Friday night. https://t.co/hPQVyjlpVS
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Ukraine is running short of Soviet-era ammunition and has not received enough from its allies, hampering its artillery war in the countryâ€™s east to keep the Russians at bay, officials say. https://t.co/ywhQPFaG6l
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
"This is a renaissance."

The nation's HBCUs are experiencing a boom in enrollment, as they're embraced by a generation shaped by the first Black president, Black Lives Matter and shifting views on what constitutes the pinnacle of higher education. https://t.co/t3mqgCDiVJ https://t.co/72A7lV24cF

nodes.title:
In Opinion

The prime-time Jan. 6 committee hearing "was about Trump as a callous monster, and many will come away convinced that he should be criminally charged and put in jail," @maureendowd writes. "Lock him up!" https://t.co/HS5zUYC73s

nodes.title: The Versace dress that Britney Spears wore to marry Sam Asghari this week was a symbol of her new era of independence â€” and a nod of sorts to her own 1990s trendsetting self. https://t.co/blxdKbtb68
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: "The Wire," which premiered in June 2002, told a sweeping story of crime, punishment and institutional disintegration in Baltimore. 20 years on, some of the showâ€™s stars looked back and broke down some of its most pivotal scenes. https://t.co/DSrAPjCiJb

nodes.title: Better treatment for mental illness would do little to curb gun violence, @amybarnhorst says. Higher age requirements for gun purchases and "red flag" laws would have more impact, she says. Listen to the full conversation with @NYTLiz and @DrJDFord. https://t.co/hEXFMMPVZw https://t.co/csKWruslBp

nodes.title: The worst drought in four decades, and a rise in food prices caused by the war in Ukraine, have left almost half of Somaliaâ€™s people facing food shortages. At least 448 children have died from severe acute malnutrition since January, according to UNICEF. https://t.co/fmmOCIRbkS

nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: After Uvalde, Buffalo and hundreds of other mass shootings, protests organized by March for Our Lives drew thousands of people across the country Saturday to demonstrate against gun violence and call for federal legislation limiting military-style weapons. https://t.co/ttEg7jKmHo https://t.co/1VrIicKrKx
